lexUnit.name: therapist.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: somebody specializing in a particular course of treatment or rehabilitation

sentence.text: Every therapist of emotional pain , no matter their particular style , sees the discharge of feeling through tears as a positive and healing experience .
Most importantly , there will be an empathy between yourself and your therapist .
Of course , it is equally important for your therapist to feel at ease with you , to facilitate an exchange of energies , as it were .
Liz and her therapist arranged to meet initially three rimes and then decide whether further contact was necessary .
They are also supported by psychiatric , social work and child care consultants , with further therapeutic care provided by a qualified art therapist .
Anne Hooper , counsellor , sex therapist , author and mother , offers her help and advice .
Sex manuals and sex therapists soon flooded the market to help people make the grade .
She says working as a shiatsu therapist is also risky because the treatment is expensive and people are not always willing to pay when money is short .
Liz came back accompanied by her parents , but wanting to speak to the therapist on her own first .
Involvement of the same therapist in assessment and follow-up is likely to increase attendance rates ( Hawton et al. 1979 ) .
Despite describing a happy childhood , she told her therapist about how she had been brought up in a family where she felt unappreciated and undervalued .

I went for my first visit to the therapist feeling panicky , nervous , hopeful and depressed .
I went to see my therapist and he kept talking about the bank manager .

The therapist agreed to see David daily for the next few days in order to provide him with support .
